business.headline: India lifted 171 million people from extreme poverty from 2012 to 2022: World BankRural extreme poverty dropped from 18.4 per cent to 2.8 per cent, and urban from 10.7 per cent to 1.1 per cent, narrowing the rural-urban gap from 7.7 to 1.7 percentage points.

Changing jobs? Check this EPFO update on PF transfersEffective January 2025, the requirement for employer approval in most transfer cases has been eliminated. Previously, PF balance transfers required coordination between source and destination EPFO offices, often causing delays.

E-commerce, crops, data storage top India-US trade deal negotiations: ReportDiscussions will now begin on issues such as market access for US farm goods, India's data localisation rules, and the role of big tech in e-commerce—areas that have previously proved politically sensitive in India.

Indian airlines may face turbulence as Pakistan closes its skiesPakistan has announced shutting its airspace to Indian carriers as tensions rise between the two neighbours following a deadly militant attack in Indian Kashmir earlier this week.

Samsung to invest Rs 1,000 crore in Tamil Nadu plant: ReportSamsung's Tamil Nadu factory currently employs over 2,000 people. In 2022–23, the plant contributed one-fifth of Samsung's Rs 1 lakh crore sales in India.
Sensex, Nifty close lower as rising India-Pakistan tension spooks investorsThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 588.80 points to end at 79,212.53, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 207.35 points to end at 24,039.35.

Pahalgam terror attack casts big shadow on Kashmir's booming tourism economyKashmir was slowly rebuilding its image as a peaceful tourist destination after years of conflict, especially after the abrogation of Article 370 in August 2019.

Sebi revises cut-off timings for overnight mutual fund redemptions. Details hereSebi aims to make sure stock brokers and clearing members use client funds wisely by investing in secure overnight mutual fund schemes (MFOS).

Air India may buy 10 Boeing planes turned down by China: ReportThe ongoing trade tensions between the US and China, marked by steep duties above 100%, have impacted various sectors, even the aviation industry has taken a hit.
Pakistan Stock Exchange portal crashes amid rising geopolitical heatThe online portal of PSX showed a message saying "We'll be back soon," indicating that the website was temporarily unavailable.

Bengaluru resident shares costly homebuying mistake: 'Don't fall for FOMO'A social media user from Bengaluru shared that he has been living in Bengaluru for the past six years. Like many others, he moved to the city for better career opportunities. Despite being financially stable, he chose to rent rather than buy a flat. But the trouble started soon after.

Sensex, Nifty tank: Indo-Pak tensions trigger market crash. Check top losersSensex plunged over 1,000 points, while Nifty tanked over 300 points, falling below 24,000 as uncertainty prevailed over geopolitical tensions.

Apple plans to make all US iPhones in India by 2026: ReportThe said move is part of Apple's long-term plan to reduce its dependence on China, especially after the recent tariff rules announced by US President Donald Trump.

Ather Energy IPO: Check latest GMP as Rs 3,000 crore public listing to open soonThe Ather Energy IPO will be a book-built issue. It consists of a fresh issue of 8.18 crore equity shares worth Rs 2,626 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 1.11 crore shares worth Rs 354.76 crore.

Sensex falls 1,000 points: Why is stock market falling today despite early gains?Sensex and Nifty plunged more than 1% reacting to uncertainty over geopolitical tensions. The S&P BSE Sensex tanked 1,026.28 points to 78,775.15, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 330.40 points to 23,916.30 as of 11:41 am.
Sensex, Nifty erase early gains as markets react to Kashmir terror attackThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 492.29 points to 79,309.14, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 172.15 points to 24,074.55 as of 10 am.

Sensex, Nifty today: Will Dalal Street return to winning ways on April 25?Stock market today: Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,522 as of 7:48 am, which is about 1.1% above Thursday's Nifty50 close of 24,246.7.

Stocks to watch today: RIL, Axis Bank, Gensol, IndusInd Bank, Maruti SuzukiReliance Industries will announce its results for the March 2025 quarter today. The market will be watching closely for updates on its energy, telecom, and retail businesses.

ED raids Gensol promoters, detains Puneet Jaggi from Delhi hotel: ReportSources said the probe agency has invoked provisions under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) following findings of fund diversion and misrepresentation flagged earlier by the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi).

Pay10 becomes first entity to go live on CBUAE's open finance frameworkThe new license gives Pay10 secure, real-time access to consumer bank accounts, enabling seamless third-party financial services. This sets the foundation for broader innovations in areas such as embedded finance, digital identity, and interoperable payment systems.

Kumar Mangalam Birla to receive Lata Deenanath Mangeshkar Award 2025The 57-year-old industrialist, Padma Bhushan awardee and Chairman of the Aditya Birla Group, is being honoured for his pivotal role in shaping India's growth story.
'Wives are smarter': Harsh Goenka's gold vs gadget lesson goes viralOn April 24, at 10.30 am, gold on the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) was at Rs 95,893 per 10 grams, up Rs 1,171.

Sensex, Nifty snap 7-day winning streak, HUL falls 4% after Q4 resultsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 315.06 points to 79,801.43 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 82.25 points to settle at 24,246.70.

India hits pause on Indus Waters Treaty: Could this dry up Pakistan's economy?India has suspended the Indus Waters Treaty (IWT). The announcement was made by Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri on Wednesday, a day after a deadly attack in Pahalgam killed several civilians.

Gold vs mutual funds: What should you invest in for better returns?Gold is often seen as a safe investment. When markets are shaky or inflation rises, many investors turn to gold. On the other hand, mutual funds, particularly equity funds, are linked to the stock market. When the market does well, your mutual fund investment can grow faster.

Gold prices today: Check rates in metro cities. What to expect?On the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX), gold was priced at Rs 95,893 per 10 grams at 10.30 am, which was a rise of Rs 1,171 from the last close.
ITR filing 2025: Last date, refund timeline and documents. All you need to knowYou can submit your ITR for the year of assessment 2025-26 once the online portal goes live.

Middle-class stuck in debt trap, says Marcellus Investment's Saurabh MukherjeaUsing data from the Reserve Bank of India, Mukherjea estimates that 5-10% of middle-class households are now stuck in a debt trap.

Want to share UPI with family? Check steps to use BHIM app's UPI CircleUPI Circle is a feature where the main UPI account holder or the primary user can authorise up to five trusted people, i.e., secondary users to make UPI payments using his account.
Gensol says no ED notice received by company, stock continues steep fallGensol share price: The stock fell 5% to hit the lower circuit limit and has fallen over 50% in the last 6 months.

HUL Q4 profit falls 4% to Rs 2,464 crore; announces Rs 24 final dividendThe FMCG major reported a consolidated net profit of Rs 2,464 crore for the March quarter, down 3.7% from Rs 2,558 crore in the same period last year.

Explained: Why Rallis India shares tumbled over 6% after Q4 resultsThe Tata Group company posted a wider net loss of Rs 32 crore for the quarter ended March 31, 2025, compared to Rs 22 crore in the same period last year.

Saving for daughter? Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana still offers high interest. Check ratesSukanya Samriddhi Yojana not only offers high interest but also tax-free returns, thus making it one of the safest savings options for families with a girl child.

UBS upgrades stance on Indian stock markets, but finds China 'more attractive'Despite India's promising fundamentals, China remains UBS's top pick among emerging markets (EM), thanks to cheaper valuations and a stronger risk-reward profile.
Sensex, Nifty slip as investors book profit after 7-day market rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex fell by 159.23 points to 79,957.26, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 72.20 points to 24,256.75 as of 9:28 am.

ICAI to examine books of crisis-hit Gensol Engineering and BluSmartGensol Engineering and BluSmart are currently facing scrutiny after serious questions were raised about their financial dealings and governance practices.

Stock market opening: Sensex, Nifty to extend gains beyond 80,000?Sensex, Nifty expectation: Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,415.5 at 8:01 am, up 0.3% from Wednesday's Nifty50 close of 24,328.95, signalling a higher opening.

Stocks to watch on April 24: HUL, Nestle, SBI Life, Axis Bank, Adani GreenShares of HUL, Axis Bank, Tech Mahindra, Nestle, Persistent Systems and SBI Life Insurance Company will be closely watched today as the companies are set to announce their fourth quarter earnings.

From watches to antiques, these luxury goods above Rs 10 lakh face 1% TCSThe Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) has issued fresh guidelines to enforce the levy, which aims to plug tax leaks and boost visibility on big-ticket purchases.

'Operation Zeppelin' reveals details of Adani's counter to Hindenburg: ReportIn January 2023, Hindenburg published a scathing report against the Adani Group. The counter to its damning report against the conglomerate was dubbed 'Operation Zeppelin'.

entertainment.headline: TV actor Navina Bole accuses Sajid Khan of misconduct, says he asked her to stripTV actor Navina Bole has come forward with allegations against filmmaker Sajid Khan, accusing him of inappropriate behaviour during a meeting. This adds to the growing list of accusations against Khan, who has been previously named in other misconduct cases.

Havoc review: Tom Hardy is the only saving grace in Gareth Evans' gore actionerReleased-Fri Apr 25, 2025Netflix's 'Havoc', directed by Gareth Evans, pairs Tom Hardy with a thrilling plot, but ultimately disappoints. Why? Read on and find out.

Fleeing Romania to being an Oscar nominee: Why Sebastian Stan is truly a starActor Sebastian Stan's journey from Romania to ruling the roost in Hollywood is anything but typical. From a childhood under a strict regime to becoming a celebrated actor, Stan's story is one of resilience and talent.

Ground Zero box office Day 2: Emraan Hashmi film picks pace, collects Rs 3 croreEmraan Hashmi's military drama 'Ground Zero' is witnessing growth at the box office despite facing competition from other Bollywood films. The film chronicles the story of BSF officer Narendra Nath Dhar Dubey's operation against terrorist mastermind Ghazi Baba.

The Diplomat OTT release: When, where to watch John Abraham's political thriller'The Diplomat', starring John Abraham, is reportedly set to premiere on Netflix on May 9, 2025. The film delves into the intricacies of diplomacy and personal conflicts, inspired by the true story of Indian diplomat JP Singh.

Sinners production designer reveals hidden tribute to Chadwick BosemanIn a recent interview, 'Sinners' production designer Hannah Bleacher unveiled a subtle tribute to Chadwick Boseman embedded in the film.

Woh gussa fir se jaaga hai: Akshay Kumar on Pahalgam attack at Kesari 2 screeningAkshay Kumar attended a screening of Kesari Chapter 2 and addressed the audience about the Pahalgam terror attack, expressing anger. He said that the anger Indians had after Jallianwala Bagh incident has been rekindled.

Justin Bieber's grandfather dies at 80. Singer, wife Hailey pay tributePop icon Justin Bieber mourns the loss of his grandfather, Bruce Dale, who died at 80. The singer shared a loving tribute on Instagram.

Kesari Chapter 2 box office Day 9: Akshay Kumar film sees jump, earns Rs 57 croreKesari 2, starring Akshay Kumar, R Madhavan, and Ananya Panday, is maintaining a good momentum at the box office. The film has already crossed Rs 50 crore mark and also witnessed a jump in numbers on Day 9.

Directors Khalid Rahman, Ashraf Hamza arrested for possession of hybrid ganjaDirector Khalid Rahman, who directed the recently-released film 'Alapuzzha Gymkhana' and director Ashraf Hamza, along with one other, were arrested for the possession of hybrid ganja by the Excise department of Kochi.

Madhuri Dixit's in-laws 'weren't happy' when husband Shriram Nene moved to IndiaMadhuri Dixit and her husband Dr Shriram Nene relocated to India after years in the USA, where Dr Nene had a successful medical career. Despite initial resistance from his parents, Dr Nene transitioned from being a heart surgeon to a medical-tech entrepreneur.

Waqt: An absurd masterpiece of earthquakes, epiphanies and Raaj Kumar at his best'Waqt', the 1965 blockbuster directed by Yash Chopra, is a quintessential masala film that blends drama, music, and a star-studded cast. Known for its engaging narrative and memorable performances, it remains a beloved classic in Hindi cinema.

Karthik Subbaraj on why romance is the soul of Suriya's RetroDirector Karthik Subbaraj, known for films like 'Pizza' and 'Jigarthanda', is shifting focus to romance in his latest venture 'Retro'. Starring Suriya, the film delves into love's transformative power against a vintage gangster backdrop.

AR Rahman, Ponniyin Selvan 2 makers face Rs 2 crore fine in copyright caseThe Delhi High Court has intervened in a copyright dispute involving composer A R Rahman and the film 'Ponniyin Selvan 2'. The court found Rahman's song identical to the Junior Dagar Brothers' Shiv Stuti.

Content creator Misha Agarwal dies two days before 25th birthdayInfluencer Misha Agarwal has passed away just days before her 25th birthday, leaving her followers and family in shock. The cause of her death is yet to be revealed.

Karisma sent people to spy on Raveena's look: Andaz Apna Apna designer AshleyThe beloved cult classic 'Andaz Apna Apna' returns to cinemas, bringing back memories for costume designer Ashley Rebello, who reminisces about creating iconic looks for the film's stars. He recounted a behind-the-scene anecdote before the shoot of the song 'Yeh Raat Aur Yeh Doori'.

Dan Da Dan S2 trailer promises more full-throttle action, quirk. WatchThe new trailer for Dan Da Dan's second season delves into the intense battle between Okarun and the possessed Jiji, promising an action-packed continuation. With familiar faces returning to the creative team, the series is set to stream from July 3 on Netflix and Crunchyroll.

Ground Zero Day 1: Emraan Hashmi film starts slow at Rs 1 croreGround Zero, starring Emraan Hashmi, had a slow start at the box office with a collection of Rs 1 crore on its opening day. The film, produced by Excel Entertainment, chronicles the story of BSF officer Narendra Nath Dhar Dubey's operation against terrorist mastermind Ghazi Baba.

Martin Scorsese 'glad' to join Neeraj Ghaywan's Homebound as executive producerFilmmaker Martin Scorsese has joined Neeraj Ghaywan's 'Homebound' as an executive producer. The film will premiere at the 2025 Cannes Film Festival in the Un Certain Regard section.

general news.headline: Terrorists trekked 22 hours through rough terrain for Pahalgam attack: SourcesTwo mobile phones - one belonging to a local resident and the other to a tourist - were snatched by the terrorists during the Pahalgam attack, sources said. Four attackers were involved in the carnage: three foreign terrorists and one local militant, Adil Thokar, sources added.
2 children die after massive fire breaks out at jhuggi cluster in Delhi's RohiniTwo children die, 800 shanties gutted as massive fire breaks out at jhuggi cluster in Delhi's Rohini

Heart-broken: Teary-eyed Pak girl leaves Indian mother behind amid expulsionZainab, 11, and Zenish, 8, arrived in India with their mother, who holds an Indian passport, to meet their grandmother in Delhi last month. Little did they know that within a month, the situation between the countries would hit an all-time low.

Terror attack or accident? Car rams crowd at Vancouver festival, at least 9 deadAt least 9 people have been killed in Vancouver after a car rammed a crowd. Videos that have emerged on social media from the scene show several bodies strewn across the street. A black SUV, which reportedly drove into the crowd, was seen beside a blue truck with a crushed bonnet, next to the crime scene.

Video: Indian Navy warships fire missiles, display 'combat-ready' strike powerThe Indian Navy has conducted multiple mission exercises involving anti-ship firings of various missile systems. The exercise included the firing of Brahmos, one of the deadliest long-range missiles, along with medium and short-range missile systems. This demonstration of naval firepower comes in the wake of the Pahalgam attack, sending a strong message about India's combat readiness to safeguard its interests anywhere, anytime.

DC vs RCB Live: Virat Kohli returns to Delhi in battle for top spotIPL 2025, DC vs RCB Live Score: Axar Patel's Delhi Capitals are looking to reclaim their top spot and take a step closer to the playoffs. The Challengers also have a chance to go back to the top of the table.

130 nukes aimed at you: Pak minister's open threat to India as tensions flareHanif Abbasi said if India dares to halt Pakistan's water supply by suspending the Indus Waters Treaty, it should "prepare for a full-scale war". He declared that Pakistan's nuclear weapons are not for display, and their locations are hidden across the country.

Tree-top video, Army officer's statement critical to Pahalgam terror probeThe NIA has launched a detailed probe into the Pahalgam terror attack, with a crucial video evidence from a local photographer and eyewitness testimony from an army officer to reconstruct how Pak-based terrorists brutally killed 26 people in the Baisaran Valley.

Forget IPL contracts, gully cricket can help earn big money and fameFame and money in cricket isn't just in IPL or internationals. Even without playing professional cricket, scores of Indians are emerging as stars due to gully cricket. The Indian Street Premier League (ISPL), with an IPL-like model, revolutionised tennis-ball cricket. Not just ISPL, scores of tournaments in several states are attracting prominent organisers and sponsors, and promising big money.

10 killed as van falls into 'poisonous' well in Madhya PradeshA van carrying thirteen people fell into a well in Madhya Pradesh's Mandasur. Four people swam to safety while one died while attempting to rescue another.

Are they Indians: Himanta Sarma jabs Congress MP over wife, children's Pak 'links'Though the chief minister did not name the MP in the social media post, he and the BJP have been attacking Gaurav Gogoi, the Deputy Leader of Congress in Lok Sabha, for some time over his wife's alleged connection with Pakistan.

MI vs LSG, Live: Trent Boult removes Mitchell Marsh to dent LSG chaseIPL 2025, Mumbai Indians (MI) vs Lucknow Super Giants (LSG): Ayush Badoni and David Miller need to script a miracle. LSG need 82 runs in their last six overs. Trent Boult gave Mumbai Indians a huge breakthrough by removing Mitchell Marsh, who was looking to cut loose.

Ego scrolling, a troubling trend on dating apps?Though it may seem harmless, indulging in ego-scrolling can negatively impact others, causing them to doubt themselves and contributing to dating app fatigue.

Indian woman stopped at Attari border while trying to return to Pak with childrenSana, an Indian citizen married to a Pakistani in 2020, had come to India to visit her paternal home in Meerut. As the situation between the two countries grew tense following the Pahalgam attack, she planned to go back before scheduled.

Wazar-e-Ala: BJP slams Siddaramaiah for 'no need for war with Pak' remarkThe BJP sharply criticised Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah for his remarks stating there was 'no need for war' against Pakistan, calling him Wazir-e-Ala, Urdu term of Chief Minister.

No more surgical strikes, reclaim POK: Trinamool's Abhishek Banerjee to PMTrinamool Congress leader and MP Abhishek Banerjee asserted that it is time to teach Pakistan a lesson and reclaim the portion of Kashmir occupied by the neighbouring country.

In sea of black, Trump's blue suit at Pope Francis's funeral raises eyebrowsThe other global leaders, including French President Emmanuel Macron of France, British Prime Minister Keir Starmer, President Javier Milei of Argentina and Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni were all in black as they stood together in St Peter's Square to pay their final respects to Pope Francis.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

272 Pakistanis left India via Attari border, more to exit today as deadline endsThe government issued the 'Leave India' notice to Pakistani nationals after 26 people, mostly tourists, were killed in a terrorist attack linked to Pakistan at Pahalgam in Jammu and Kashmir on April 22.

POK flood alert after Pakistan accuses India of Jhelum water release: ReportThe allegations came after India decided to suspend the 1960 Indus Waters Treaty, in response to the deadly terror attack in Pahalgam carried out by Pakistan-based terrorists.

Waqt: An absurd masterpiece of earthquakes, epiphanies and Raaj Kumar at his best'Waqt', the 1965 blockbuster directed by Yash Chopra, is a quintessential masala film that blends drama, music, and a star-studded cast. Known for its engaging narrative and memorable performances, it remains a beloved classic in Hindi cinema.

Chicago-bound flight turns messy as woman strips naked, defecates on seatA woman stripped naked and defecated on her seat during a Southwest Airlines flight from Philadelphia to Chicago, prompting an emergency response and thorough aircraft cleaning.

Indians involved in Pakistan Super League return to countryThe Pakistan Cricket Board facilitated the return of 23 Indian nationals who were involved in the production duties of Pakistan Super League, following the Pahalgam terror attack. This move comes amid rising diplomatic tensions between the two nations.

Kashmir saw progress, but terrorists want to destroy it: PM on Pahalgam attackSpeaking during the 121st episode of his radio programme 'Mann Ki Baat', PM Modi said Kashmir had witnessed unprecedented growth in recent years, with booming tourism, vibrant schools and colleges and a surge in opportunities for the youth, but terrorists want to derail the region's progress.

sports.headline: MI vs LSG: Gutted Rishabh Pant consoled by Zaheer Khan after another flopshowRishabh Pant's disastrous IPL 2025 campaign continued with another early dismissal against Mumbai Indians, but Lucknow Super Giants mentor Zaheer Khan was quick to console his skipper, offering a reassuring gesture.

Antonio Rudiger issues apology after Copa del Rey outburst: Did a mistakeAntonio Rudiger issued a public apology after his furious outburst during Real Madrid's Copa del Rey final loss, admitting shame over throwing an ice pack at the referee.

DC vs RCB Live: Virat Kohli returns to Delhi in battle for top spotIPL 2025, DC vs RCB Live Score: Axar Patel's Delhi Capitals are looking to reclaim their top spot and take a step closer to the playoffs. The Challengers also have a chance to go back to the top of the table.

Indomitable Barcelona targetting treble: Hansi Flick after Copa del Rey winFC Barcelona are aiming for the treble this season, said manager Hansi Flick after the team beat Real Madrid in the Copa del Rey final to win the first major competition of the season.

MI vs LSG: Mayank Yadav hits 140-plus kph on IPL return, bags 2 big wicketsIPL 2025, MI vs LSG: Express fast bowler Mayank Yadav bowled with control and consistency on his return to competitive cricket for the first time since October 2024. He got the wickets of Rohit Sharma and Hardik Pandya in Mumbai on Sunday, April 27.

Rana, bowlers script India's thumping win over Sri Lanka in tri-seriesHarmanpreet Kaur's India beat Sri Lanka by nine wickets on Sunday at the R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo to make a brilliant start to their campaign in the Women's tri-series.

Suryakumar Yadav faster than Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma to hit 4000 runs in IPLSuryakumar Yadav became the fastest Indian to score 4000 runs in IPL history, achieving the milestone in just 2714 balls during Mumbai Indians' match against Lucknow Super Giants.

Indians involved in Pakistan Super League return to countryThe Pakistan Cricket Board facilitated the return of 23 Indian nationals who were involved in the production duties of Pakistan Super League, following the Pahalgam terror attack. This move comes amid rising diplomatic tensions between the two nations.

LSG not trusting Rishabh Pant? Eoin Morgan urges captain to embrace big momentsIPL 2025, MI vs LSG: Former England captain said Rishabh Pant should embrace big moments instead of holding himself back. Pant batted at No. 7 in their limp loss to Delhi Capitals.

Mayank Yadav returns from injury layoff, returns for clash vs MITearaway fast bowler Mayank Yadav made his return to professional cricket in Lucknow Super Giants match vs Mumbai Indians. Mayank has been out of action since India's T20I match vs Bangladesh in October 2024.

Indian women's team sport black armbands to pay homage to Pahalgam attack victimsThe Indian women's cricket team was seen wearing black armbands during the opening match of the tri-nation series against Sri Lanka to pay homage to the victims of the Pahalgam terror attack.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
